job_Description: Minimum qualifications:          Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction, psychology, cognitive science, information science, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.      15 years of experience with UX design and UX research.      Experience with direct leadership of User Experience teams.      Portfolio of UX design/research work.        Preferred qualifications:          Master's degree in Design or a related field and 7 years of relevant experience.      3 years of experience managing design teams.      Experience pushing past incremental boundaries and bringing new products to market.      Understanding of the tools and techniques across web and mobile, and the applicability of a range of qualitative and quantitative methodologies.      Ability to work across the product development process, from establishing UX strategy and conceptual foundations to successfully delivering high-quality products.      Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate positions and challenge partners with new product design thinking.            About the job      Core Machine Learning (ML) is focused on driving ML excellence across Google and thereby bringing the best experience to users across the world. This organization brings together the company's ML efforts, creating a more formal path for ML experimentation, development, and product realization. By aligning infrastructure initiatives with new areas of research and product innovation, we are able to best meet the challenges and opportunities of ML technology. As the Director of UX, you will lead the UX function for the Core ML team. This team is responsible for Google’s leading machine learning technologies, in use by developers worldwide and powering some of the most complex and large-scale AI services on the planet. In this role, you will drive the vision and UX strategy for all of the ML organization, which involves owning the UX design, UX research, and Customer Experience journeys and user story-telling for Google’s ML products, including TensorFlow, Cloud TPU, and many more large-scale ML technologies.      The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.            Responsibilities           Develop a strategic vision for the UX function for Core ML.       Lead a growing UX organization responsible for user research, customer journeys, UX/UI design, and development of our product branding and naming frameworks.       Collaborate with partner engineering teams within Core, Product Areas and business teams to ensure that the work is aligned with overarching goals of Core ML and Google.       Lead the development of “well-lit paths” that help ML engineers and teams, internal and external to Google, quickly and easily leverage machine learning to create great products.       Scale the systems, either rebuilding or supporting the existing Google wide platform, in order to meet the needs of users across Google and beyond. job_title: Front End Engineer - Amazon Forecast (AWS AI)
job_Description: · Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. · 2+ years of professional front-end development · Experience with modern programming languages (JavaScript, C#, or Python) and open-source technologies. · Skilled with common front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JS, TypeScript, Node, React        Job summary    Imagine never needing to hop from store to store during holidays because your first stop can anticipate the demand for the products they carry and stock up accordingly.        Imagine never having to wait too long or pay too much because your favorite ride-hailing service can account for weather or local events and direct enough drivers to your area.        Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.        Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.        As a front-end engineer on the Amazon Forecast team, you will:           work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.     build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.     improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.        You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.        Key job responsibilities           Work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.     Build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.     Improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies. ACV’s mission is to build and enable the most trusted and efficient digital marketplaces for buying and selling used vehicles with transparency and comprehensive data that was previously unimaginable. We are powered by a combination of the world’s best people and the industry’s best technology. At ACV, we are driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and rewarded with a work environment that enables each teammate to impact the company from day one. ACV’s network of brands includes ACV Auctions, ACV Transportation, MAX Digital and ACV Capital within its Marketplace Products as well as True360 and Data Services.        What you will do:    ACV’s Machine Learning (ML) team is looking to grow its MLOps team with a senior role. Multiple ACV operations and product teams rely on the ML team’s solutions. Current deployments drive opportunities in the marketplace, in operations, and sales, to name a few. As ACV has experienced hyper growth over the past few years, the volume, variety, and velocity of these deployments has grown considerably. Thus, the training, deployment, and monitoring needs of the ML team has grown as we’ve gained traction. MLOps is a critical function to help ourselves continue to deliver value to our partners and our customers. This role will work closely with MLEs specialized in model R&D to understand the unique needs of production-level ML models, and ACV infrastructure team to leverage the state-of-the-art software infrastructure support. You will lead the initiatives of improving and extending current MLOps practice and capabilities, to empower the ML team to be more productive. In addition you will get to solve challenging and complex business problems that will make an impact on the company bottom line and you will report directly to the manager of the ML team.        Required Qualifications:          Must be excited by and have professional experience with the engineering, devOps, tracking, and pipeline needs of data-heavy, ML-enable products.     This is an MLOps role, scaling and monitoring large ML production systems is the job.     Graduate education in a computationally intensive domain.     3+ years software development experience, preferably related to ML or Data Science.     1+ years as tech lead or major contributor on cross-team projects.     Experience with cloud services (AWS / GCP) and kubernetes, docker, CI/CD in python. Data Science skills like vectorized scientific programming and exploratory data analysis       What we will offer:          Comprehensive benefits offerings for benefits eligible Teammates. Ciitizen is now Invitae, bringing together the power of genomic and clinical information within a new kind of patient data platform to improve healthcare decision making at personal and systemwide levels.  Ciitizen is a health technology platform that enables patients with cancer and rare neurologic disorders to collect, digitize, and share their health information. Funded by Andreessen-Horowitz and founded by serial entrepreneur and former Head of Health at Apple (Anil Sethi), it began with the simple idea that anyone should be able to manage their own medical records but was motivated by the harder reality of helping Anil's own sister fight her battle with cancer.  Our mission is for patients to control their healthcare data so that they can control their healthcare options.  In this role, you help build our unstructured data extraction pipeline. You will be responsible for leveraging the latest machine learning and NLP technology to structure and normalize data from medical records. You like digging into messy data, working with clinical subject matter experts to develop annotation guidelines to produce high-quality machine learning models. You will touch all parts of the machine learning project lifecycle from dataset curation to model deployment.  What you will do:   Formulate healthcare data structuring challenges into ML/NLP solvable problems  Innovate and ideate novel ML/NLP-driven solutions for structuring healthcare data  Create prototypes and collaborate with engineering for successful product integration and testing  Measure and evaluate the performance and present results to stakeholders  Collaborate with clinicians and ML/NLP experts to unlock new capabilities   Requirements:   Masters in Computer Science or a related field with at least two years of work experience prototyping and deploying NLP / ML models or PhD/graduate with a focus on NLP.  Proficiency with Python.  In Depth knowledge of state-of-the-art DL techniques and architectures such as Transformers, RNN, etc and practical knowledge of pre-trained neural language models such as BERT, ROBERTa, etc.  Familiarity with open source ML/DL frameworks (Pytorch, TensorFlow, Keras)  Demonstrated experience developing solutions for NLP tasks such as Topic Modeling, Classification, Named Entity Recognition, or Named Entity Linking.  Experience with dockerizing code and launching them on cloud.  Only accepting US Based applicants at this time.   # LI - Remote  At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. That’s what inspires us, drives our work, and pushes us to build things that make a difference. Summary  Posted: Dec 12, 2021  Weekly Hours:  40  Role Number: 200318466  The Information Intelligence team is looking for engineers to define and architect our on-device search technologies! As part of this group, you'll work with our machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing teams, tailoring their work to run efficiently across Apple's range of products, and build partnerships across Apple in order to deliver unparalleled user experiences underpinned by modular, thoughtfully designed software.  Key Qualifications  Prior experience of developing frameworks and designing application programming interfaces  A passion for developing well-architected and modular software  Software optimization experience accompanied by knowledge of profiling tools and techniques  You are comfortable working cross-functionally and can communicate sophisticated ideas clearly  Description  You will work on defining and implementing the architecture of Apple's groundbreaking search technology across our entire range of products. You will partner closely with multiple teams across the organization, building durable and reusable technologies written with efficiency in mind. You will additionally be responsible not only for delivering the latest advances in search to our users, from text to media, but also safeguarding their privacy by leveraging the unique features of Apple devices! Successful candidates must be passionate about software architecture and system design, caring not only about user experience but also the tradeoffs and optimisations required to deliver phenomenal mobile experiences. Performance analysis and evangelism is a key part of this position, and you'll be expected to work multi-functionally with our computer vision, natural language processing, and machine learning teams to tailor their technologies for each and every Apple platform and operating system. Successful candidates must be passionate about software architecture and system design, caring not only about user experience but also the tradeoffs and optimisations required to deliver great mobile experiences. Performance analysis and evangelism is a key part of this position, and you'll be expected to work cross-functionally with our computer vision, natural language processing, and machine learning teams to tailor their technologies for each and every Apple platform and operating system.  Education & Experience  BS in Computer Science or equivalent proven experience. Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. The Identity Security Team is responsible for ensuring the integrity and security of the services we operate (Azure Active Directory & Microsoft Account), as well as the consumer and commercial identities we manage. Each day, our detection systems and machine learning algorithms evaluate and risk score more than 18 billion logins daily for more than 800 million customers monthly (including for O365, Xbox, OneDrive, & Azure). In addition to ensuring the veracity of interactions powering the global digital economy, our efforts are at the core of Microsoft’s commitment to defend democracy worldwide.              We are seeking a talented individual to join our world-class team of investigators and Technical Program Managers – your passion for protecting customers, comfort with ambiguity, and motivation to deliver consistently exceptional performance under high pressure, will be highly valued. Your ability to drive clarity in the face of incidents, massive data and ambiguous indicators via automation will be critical in helping us continue to successfully execute against our mission. We are experiencing unprecedented business growth so if you are motivated by the challenge of using your skills & knowledge to help protect nearly a billion people worldwide, come join us!              This role will work with other leaders across Microsoft’s security ecosystem to develop and deliver a five-year strategy that will make our customers and the industry safer.              #IdentityJobs          This role is open to Remote work       Responsibilities            Respond to security incidents (on-call) as Incident Manager- lead teams to identify, isolate, remediate, and root cause of Identity compromises      Identify and analyze new data sources to find novel patterns that can be transformed into new automated detections      Conceptualize, implement and analyze metrics to assess the quality of our detections and improve in real time      Develop and enhance processes and policies across Microsoft that improve and accelerate response      Set priorities for product enhancements based on data/learnings from incidents        Qualifications         Required Qualifications:            5+ years' experience as a data scientist, software engineer, or security researcher      Experience leading cross-team security incidents.      Experience deploying infrastructure security against cyber attacks               Preferred Qualifications:            Previous experience in any of the following: identity systems, security, threat intelligence, fraud, abuse      Outstanding math and statistics skills with demonstrated analytics experience      An ability to drive good decisions through data with great attention to detail and excellent logical problem-solving skills      Graduate degree in computer science, machine learning, statistics, or quantitative domain      Strong communication skills with a demonstrated bias towards collaboration and team work                 Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:          Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.              Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Wayfair Data Science powers automation & decision support across all Wayfair business units. Our algorithms tackle a varied & broad spectrum of challenges in the Wayfair marketplace; from empowering suppliers to easily add products to our catalog, to enabling our customers to discover and purchase a vast & diverse assortment of home goods and providing them the necessary sales and service support along their journey  At Wayfair, we care about our customers! Our Sales teams balance technology and human empathy to build customer trust and loyalty. This leader will own the development of algorithmic decision support systems that power a broad spectrum of decisions across sales & service journey over multiple touchpoints (phone, chat, email, self-service, more..). The team leader owns the vision and execution of a broad portfolio of initiatives, spanning a range of internal stakeholder groups, that govern the customer interaction experience with a primary focus on developing contact intent platform that power Virtual Assistant, personalization of storefront experience, algorithmic routing of customers to the right channel/agent and many more! This is an ideal opportunity for a leader who enjoys working on a variety of scientific and technical challenges, is passionate about building effective cross-functional relationships through exceptional communication skills, and is eager to make an impact on customers' end-to-end experience through advanced data science and machine learning techniques.  What You'll Do   Lead a team that applies state of the art data science and machine learning techniques to better predict the contact intent of the customer and personalize the interaction  Leading Natural Language Understanding (NLU) development processes to power customer interactions in multiple languages  Drive significant business growth by collaborating with business, product, engineering teams to identify and solve high-impact ML problems  Manage a portfolio of existing initiatives and evolve them to be scalable, platform-oriented data science products  Lead the design and development of intelligent products that leverage a wide variety of data sources to improve customer and agent experience   What You'll Need Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields; PhD preferred  6+ years of experience leading multi-disciplinary technical teams of scientists, analysts, and engineers of varied levels of experience. Track record of developing and managing high-performing teams  2+ years experience managing technical or science teams in the NLU field  Thorough command of general data science and machine learning techniques  Relevant experience designing and implementing customer-facing systems that are scalable, fast, and resilient  Track record of delivering large cross-functional projects and managing multiple stakeholders with competing priorities  Good understanding of experimental techniques for the design of A/B tests to measure impact  Communication skills that can influence across organizations and at all levels  About Wayfair Inc.  Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

job_title: Senior Lead Data Scientist, AWS Product Analytics
job_Description: Master’s degree or equivalent in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Applied Math, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Marketing Research, or related quantitative fields     4+ years of work experience applying various statistical and machine learning methods, such as regression, classification, forecasting, causal inference, experiment design, and deep learning     4+ years' of experience with scripting languages (e.g. Python), data querying languages (e.g. SQL), and statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R, SAS)     Excellent verbal and written communication to communicate with business partners     Demonstrated ability to independently drive the full life-cycle of a data science project           Job summary    Amazon is looking for an outstanding Data Scientist to join the AWS Product Analytics Data Science team. This is your opportunity to be a core member of the AWS Product Analytics team that has direct impact on the long-term roadmap of the AWS Product teams. This role is within a larger Data science, Business Intelligence & Data engineering team that focuses on using statistical modeling and machine learning to drive actionable and impactful business decisions across AWS. Since early 2006, AWS has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. AWS is a high-growth, fast-moving division within Amazon with a start-up mentality where new and diverse challenges arise every day.        On the AWS Product Analytics team, you will be surrounded by people who are exceptionally talented, bright, and driven, and believe that data-driven decision making is critical to our success. To be successful in this role, you have a strong passion for analytics and accountability, set high standards with a focus on superior business outcome. You should also have strong business acumen who feels comfortable tackling ambiguous business problems in dynamic business environment. Your decision will influence AWS VP and Director level product and business decisions that directly impact AWS’ product roadmap and customer experience.        We take working hard, having fun, and making history seriously. AWS sets the standard for functionality, cost, and performance for many cloud-based services, but it’s still early days for cloud computing, and there are boundless opportunities to continue to redefine the world of cloud computing - come help us make history!        Key job responsibilities    The successful candidate will have a strong quantitative background and can thrive in an environment that leverages statistics, machine learning, operations research, econometrics, and strong business acumen. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will discover and solve real world problems by analyzing one of the world’s largest datasets, developing statistical and machine learning models to drive business decisions, mentoring junior scientists with best practices, leading science research and development roadmap. You will also collaborate closely with business leaders, software engineers, economists, and researchers.            You will function as the tech lead of the team, setting the best practices for delivering high quality data science projects, influencing analytics roadmap, setting best practices, and providing guidance to the junior scientists.      You will work on high visibility and high business impact problems that directly influence AWS product roadmaps and business decisions. You will spend time formulating and defining science problem based on business requirements.      You will translate business problems into analytical framework and form testing hypotheses that can be answered with available data using scientific methods or identify additional data needed in the master datasets to fill any gaps      You have real-world experience solving medium to large sized statistical and machine learning projects. You will work on a diverse set of analytics problems, such as user growth, pricing, forecasting, causal inference, marketing research, experimentation, and other machine learning problems      You will collaborate with cross-function teams with AWS business leaders, data engineers, software engineers, economists, and other scientists      You have the opportunity to work with some of the world’s largest and diverse datasets. You will help define key performance indicators for key business programs and propose analytics framework that drive business value      You are familiar with state-of-the-art statistical and machine learning methods, understand the full life-cycle of analytics projects, have hands-on experience building end-to-end analytics solutions        About the team    Inclusive Team Culture    Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.        Work/Life Balance    Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.    This position involves on-call responsibilities, typically for one week every two months. We don’t like getting paged in the middle of the night or on the weekend, so we work to ensure that our systems are fault tolerant. When we do get paged, we work together to resolve the root cause so that we don’t get paged for the same issue twice.        Mentorship & Career Growth    Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.        A day in the life    You will work directly with internal stakeholders including, product managers, go-to-market leaders, and other business leaders at Director and VP level. You will work with customer face-to-face by decompose their ambiguous business problem into a science problem. You will lead the science methodology development and coach junior scientists. You will set best practices and technical standard for the team. You will look around the corner and anticipate any business needs and challenges in the future. You will lead a science research and publication roadmap to improve the technical bar for the team.        About the team    We are trusted analytics thought partner to enable AWS product and business leaders to make informed product decisions and drive revenue growth, through rigorous science methods, reusable analytics frameworks, and scalable analytics products.               PhD degree or equivalent in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Applied Math, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Marketing Research, or related quantitative fields      6+ years of work experience applying various statistical and machine learning methods, such as regression, classification, forecasting, causal inference, experimentation, marketing research, or deep learning      Sound business judgment with demonstrated ability to balance technical and business needs to make the right decisions about technology, models and methodologies      Experience with AWS or other Cloud technologies is preferred      Experience working in product analytics team is preferred      Experience of building and deploying large-scale machine learning system      Experience in consulting firm, marketing research, and team leading experience is preferred        Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

job_title: Sr. Product Manager – Analytics & Data- Remote
job_Description: Job Title  Sr. Product Manager – Analytics & Data   * Job Location *Remote USA   * About Us* The food service industry is rapidly digitizing, creating a wave of change driving career opportunities for those with an entrepreneurial mindset, a strong work ethic, and the willingness to adapt and grow. iFoodDS offers a food safety, traceability and quality platform for use across the global food supply chain (growers, harvesters, packers/shippers, processors, distributors, grocery retailers and foodservice providers). Our market is huge ($10B+), international and growing. We are at the cutting edge of a major shift in how the agricultural industry uses technology—moving from analog processes to digital systems, data analytics and Artificial Intelligence. iFoodDS enables transparency across the supply chain, and helps our customers gain process efficiencies, maintain regulatory compliance, and send safer, wholesome food to market.   * Who We are Looking For* iFoodDS is expanding its team and seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead data and analytics. This important role includes responsibility for our overall data and analytics strategy including our ETL pipeline, data warehouse, third-party data integrations, AI/ML model development and dashboards. We are looking for someone who has experience managing a customer facing data platform to work with our team of business intelligence engineers and data scientists to fulfill the needs of our customers.   * Responsibilities*      Agile product ownership of our end-to-end data platform.    Develop a deep understanding of the market needs and be the Voice of Customer in support of our engineering and development activities.    Conduct market research in the areas of grocery retail, food service and end-to-end food supply chain to support company growth and continued market leadership.    Keep current with the competitive landscape, clearly articulate the value proposition associated with iFoodDS solutions versus competitors.    Ability to identify new market needs and define data products and services to address market opportunity. Experience making trade-offs and prioritizing to deliver the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) or platform enhancement.    Work closely with the other Product Managers to ensure that our data and analytics offerings are integral to our overall SaaS products.    Work with the Marketing teams to help create compelling product marketing communications and other materials to help drive Sales enablement.     Qualifications      Experience in the product management of a data and analytics platform, preference toward experience in building out data platforms to enable predictive business insights.    Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, able to engage in technical development and design discussions while representing the business requirements of the customers.    Experience supporting technical sales activities, engaging with executives at our customers and prospects.    Experience with agile development methodologies and tools, including SCRUM and Kanban and utilization of Jira for tracking of stories, backlog and roadmap.    Knowledge of enterprise IT environments and integrations, particularly around enterprise data security, ERP systems, and supply chain management.    Superior project management and interpersonal skills, ability to maintain a keen attention to detail, multitask and work well under pressure.    Natural curiosity and creative problem-solving skills.    Team player who collaborates well with others.     Travel      Potential for up to 25% travel     Education & Work Experience      3+ years of experience in a product management or other similar role with desire to move into product management    Bachelor’s degree required; master’s degree preferred    Preferred experience in Enterprise data and SaaS business applications    Knowledge of food production and the food supply chain, including retail grocery a plus    Key Benefits    Meaningful work    Positive “Can Do” Company Culture    Competitive Benefits Package to include Medical, Dental, Vision    IRA Account Match    Flexible Vacation Policy     Please note that the Company participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, the Company is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the Company can take any action against you, including terminating your employment.   Job Type: Full-time

Johnson & Johnson Health Technology is looking for a Sr. Manager, Data Science to join a fast-paced, innovative, and highly visible team building data-driven digital solutions. The position is based at our Health Tech office in the SoMa district of San Francisco however the role can be located at any of our J&J locations.  Johnson & Johnson, through its operating companies, is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical device markets. We strive to provide scientifically sound, high quality products and services to help heal, cure disease, and improve the quality of life of patients and their loved ones. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion, J&J is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  The mission of the Health Technology team is to bring strategic insights and hands-on digital operating experience to help J&J identify, create, launch and scale transformative healthcare solutions that innovatively combine science and digital technology.  Key responsibilities include:  Leading a small data science & analytics team to build and manage dashboards and reports used by our business partners to inform critical decisions, along with the associated data pipelines, databases, and large-scale processing systems.  Collaborating with business and product development teams to review product requirements, and define specific analytics metrics and data science tasks.  Proactively surfacing key insights from our dashboards and supporting data to improve future product releases.  Engaging with other J&J teams and external partners to operationalize digital health products.  Working in an agile development team to iteratively deliver system updates and product releases.  Ensuring code quality through code reviews, thorough unit tests, and collaboration with QA.  Creating elegant, well-tested solutions to complex problems.   Qualifications   A Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent is required.  Expertise with Tableau is required.  Expertise with databases, SQL and schema design is required.  Experience with AWS data processing services is required.  Experience with Python is required.  Experience with software development standards and methodologies is required.  A results and performance driven attitude with strong sense of accountability is required.  Experience with git is a plus.  Experience with PostgreSQL is a plus.  Experience working with digital advertising platform data is a plus  Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.  At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, depending on location and subject to local legislation, candidates offered employment may be required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or, in certain countries, secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work. If you are invited to interview for the position, your recruiter will advise on the vaccine requirement status in your geographic location.   Primary Location United States-California-San Francisco-333 Bryant St  Other Locations North America-United States-New Jersey-Raritan, North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Horsham, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House, North America-United States-New Jersey-Bridgewater, North America-United States-Washington-Seattle, North America-United States-Florida-Tampa, North America-United States-New Jersey-New Brunswick, North America-United States-Massachusetts-Boston, North America-United States-Massachusetts-Cambridge, North America-United States-California-La Jolla  Organization Johnson & Johnson (6067)  Job Function R&D  Requisition ID 2206021162W

job_title: Business Analyst, Partner Support and Solutions
job_Description: 3+ years relevant experience in financial/business analysis     Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights     Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders     Experience with SQL     Experience in Excel     Job summary   Do you enjoy solving complex business problems, transforming data into insights, and using data to drive product decisions? In this position, you will directly support a globalized product that provides a layer of intelligence to display, analyze, and recommend where our customers should focus to improve their performance and efficiency. You will also give input towards defining and improving key product metrics as well as opportunities to build new solutions to business problems.      Partnering with key stakeholders, you will utilize a range of data sources and analytical tools to dig deep into the business challenges to understand and identify insights. This will directly support core product features for our customers and improve the utility of our solutions. You'll build sustainable, scalable and automated analytics that help the organization understand opportunities for efficiency and performance improvements. You will work closely with product managers, SDEs, data engineers, and senior management to define new metrics and project requirements.      In this role, you will work directly with operations teams, program, product, and tech resources to develop and execute a cross-team roadmap.The BA in this organization would focus on: 1) designing the right set of metrics that will allow us to measure our overall routing performance across key Amazon routing and case management systems, as well as 2) start to partner cross-organization within the team to standardize input data feeds into our products (forecasting, HOTW, capacity planning, finance, etc.).      Responsibilities         Develop and own the long-term vision, strategy, and roadmap for your portfolio, and think big to continuously identify new techniques and approaches worthy of investment.     Partner with business and technology stakeholders and leaders across the organization to drive strategic initiatives through leadership and influence.     Operate with significant autonomy to deliver results and achieve the goals and objectives     Lead critical experiments that help to validate hypotheses, and continue to challenge the status quo.     Develop ways to measure the effectiveness of insights and analytical recommendations provided to optimize routing systems and standardize financial contact data.     Key job responsibilities   You will learn and understand our global operations, database infrastructure, and existing performance management system functionalities. After establishing this knowledge, you will need to develop a robust set of metrics and reporting solutions to help uncover opportunities, prioritize fixes, and influencing leadership to help drive investments that reduce waste. Some of these metrics do not exist, requiring critical thought and data/metrics design. This will include complex analytics, mapping systems and datasets together, developing scalable reporting solutions, and producing narratives/documents outlining key insights and trends meant to drive investment as well as measuring the efficacy of solutions implemented over time to attribute success and impact.      A day in the life   The Selling Partners Support ecosystem is constantly evolving and our analytics systems must be maintained and adapted to ensure our measurement strategy and reporting mechanisms accommodate these changes. Build a variety of analytics and visualization solutions to support our team. Autonomously perform deep dives, uncovering new trends/areas that may need attention. Partner closely with Program Managers to help design experiments and look for new opportunities with focus on 1) designing the right set of metrics that will allow us to measure our overall routing performance across key systems, as well as 2) Standardize input data feeds into our products.      About the team   Our team is focused on operations workforce optimization for the Partner Support and Solutions organization. The team consists of experienced engineers, product managers, analysts, and data scientists, with deep knowledge of how to build and manage a variety of successful programs and products. This is a small team of experts whose focus is making sure our solutions match the needs of our business as we grow and scale without impacting our ability to support Selling Partners.            Knowledge of AWS Infrastructure including S3, Redshift and RDS     Experience with data science and predictive modeling     Experience with data visualization techniques     Experience with a business intelligence tool (e.g. OBIEE, QuickSight, Tableau)     Experience with using Python for data analysis     Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or Economics or related field.     Advanced analytical and quantitative skills and proven ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases     Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to translate key insights from complex analyses into actionable business insights     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our Opportunity:      Chewy is seeking a bright and curious Senior Data Analyst in Bellevue, WA or Boston, MA, to leverage a wide set of analytical skills to help us advance core shopping experience. You will have the opportunity to dive in and investigate strategic business problems as we grow, scale and enter new markets.      What You’ll Do:          Partner with cross functional teams (product management, engineering, and business operations) to understand the insights they need to manage and grow their businesses      Develop, maintain, and enhance analytics solutions to provide business insights that guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities      Perform investigations into data questions and weaving those findings into an effective story to be actionable for business users      Proactively monitor customer behavior to identify trends that are sources of opportunity or potential issues, determine root causes, and work with business partners on next steps.         What You’ll Need:          A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, MIS, Engineering or related quantitative discipline with at least 3 years of related, full-time experience in an analyst role working on a business team or a Master’s degree in Information Systems, or quantitative field and 2 years' experience      Strong SQL skills with a working understanding of databases, ETL process, Data Modeling on unstructured or undefined data sets across multiple business functions.      An ability to develop production level code that can be implemented at an org level      Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (Tableau, Power BI, Knime, OBIEE, Qlik, etc.)      Experience interpreting data, designing metrics and analyzing results using exploratory as well as statistical techniques      Experience presenting findings to business partners across the organization, including executive leadership      Excellent technical skills and a strong passion for data analysis and investigation and should also be intellectually curious in the quest for answers to the cause and effect of business outcomes.      A self-starter mentality and ability to operate within a fast-paced and ambiguous environment      Proven analytic skills using SAS, R or Python.      A foundational understanding of statistical techniques such as regression, predictive modeling, forecasting, time series analysis, and clustering and apply those to answer business needs         Bonus (if applicable):          Experience using Vertica, Snowflake SQL, Google analytics, BigQuery, Click stream data, Data modelling, data warehouse, ETL process      Previous experience with ecommerce retail or similar setting or marketing / advertising technology            Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members.                If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Chewy, please contact  HR@chewy.com . Summary                      Posted: Apr 14, 2022                      Weekly Hours:         40                       Role Number:        200309571                           Do you want to write software for millions of users? Push the boundaries of technology for the next generation of interactive voice assistants!? The Siri platform team is looking for a passionate performance and memory minded engineer to do just this. The team creates ground-breaking innovations for the next generation of voice assistant technology leveraging natural language processing, machine learning and large-scale distributed systems. You will deliver actionable insights to improve the core architecture and platform, especially to improve performance, reliability and accuracy of Siri. Work with other engineers in Siri’s Natural Language Processing, Speech Recognition, Search & Ranking teams to improve responsiveness, accuracy, and understandability of the product. Deliver key improvements to the architecture that enhances privacy and security of Siri.                                                    Key Qualifications                                           Passion for developing and improving highly visible products and features.            Excellent programming and debugging skills in Swift, Objective-C, C/C++.            Good understanding of data structures, design patterns, and multithreading.            Understanding of an ML-based software infrastructure.            Experience with profiling, measuring, testing, and improving performance of complex software systems is desired.            Excellent verbal and written communication skills. job_title: Applied Scientist, Alexa AI, Ambient Explorer Suggested Hints
job_Description: PhD or equivalent Master's Degree plus 4+ years of experience in CS, CE, ML or related field     2+ years of experience of building machine learning models for business application     Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language           Job summary    Amazon is looking for a creative Applied Scientist to tackle some of the most interesting problems on the leading edge of Machine Learning (ML), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Information Retrieval (IR) with our Alexa Artificial Intelligence (AI) team. Alexa AI is part of our ongoing efforts focused on reinventing information extraction and retrieval for a voice-forward, multi-modal future.        A successful candidate will develop novel ML/NLP/IR/Deep Learning technologies to make Alexa smarter. They will have a true passion for working in a collaborative, cross-functional environment that encourages thinking about optimized solutions to unique problems that do not have yet a known science solution.        If you are looking for an opportunity to solve deep technical problems and build innovative solutions in a fast-paced environment working within a smart and passionate team, this might be the role for you. You will develop and implement novel algorithms and modeling techniques to leverage and advance the state-of-the-art in technology areas that are found at the intersection of ML, NLP, IR, and Deep Learning. Your work will directly impact Amazon products and services that make use of speech and language technology. You will gain hands on experience with Alexa and large-scale computing resources.        Key job responsibilities    In this role you will:            Work collaboratively with scientists and developers to design and implement automated, scalable NLP/ML/IR models for accessing and presenting information      Drive scalable solutions from the business, to prototyping, production testing and through engineering directly to production      Drive best practices on the team, deal with ambiguity and competing objectives, and mentor and guide junior members to achieve their career growth potential.                   PhD in ML, NLP, IR, Computer Science or a related field.      Record of publication in peer-reviewed journals and conferences in the field.      3+ years of work experience      Experience in designing and building large scale ML, NLP, recommendations or IR systems.      Strong sense of ownership and drive.      Strong communication skills.      Scientific thinking and the ability to invent and simplify, a track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced the state of the art in your field of interest.      Expert in at least one more major programming language (C++, Java, or similar) and at least one scripting language (Python, or similar), and one Deep Learning Framework (MXNet, Tensor Flow, etc.).      Excellent verbal/written communication skills, including an ability to effectively collaborate with research and technical teams, earn the trust of your colleagues, and influence senior stakeholders. job_title: Chief Data Scientist in Artificial Intelligence
job_Description: Overview:        PNNL is combining profound domain expertise and creative integration of advanced hardware and software to deliver computational solutions that address complex data and analytic challenges.              Working in multidisciplinary teams, PNNL connects research and engineering to operations, providing the tools necessary to innovate quickly and field results faster. Our strengths are integrated across the data analytics lifecycle, from data acquisition and management, to analysis and decision support.    Responsibilities:        Do you want to create a legacy of meaningful research for the greater good? Do you want to lead and contribute to work in support of an organization that addresses some of today’s most challenging problems that face our Nation? Join us in the Data Sciences and Analytics Group at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL), and shape the future today!              We seek a world-class expert in Artificial Intelligence research who brings a wealth of domain expertise and experience solving multi and transdisciplinary problems with national and international impact. This position requires thought leadership and technical depth to support the sponsors of PNNL’s National Security Directorate in the development and advancement of data science and artificial intelligence research. Research of interest includes developing, implementing, and resulting analyses of national security capabilities related to remote sensing, human language technologies, computer vision, image/video understanding, and other related fields.              The Chief Data Scientist in Artificial Intelligence should have the following attributes:           Experience in successfully building and executing AI programs requiring interactions with Government, military, academic, and industry officials nationwide for a variety of programs, projects, and tasks, including technical and programmatic concept development, planning, coordination, integration, and execution that can be supported by data science and deep learning techniques.      Experience applying machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to domain-specific applications, such as natural language processing, remote-sensing and geo-spatial intelligence, social computing, time series prediction, computer vision, etc.      Familiar with existing deep learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe2) and machine learning packages (i.e., sklearn).      Ability to contribute that knowledge to the academic and research strength of PNNL and have experience writing scientific publications demonstrating their insight and discovery (e.g., publication in conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, ICWSM, EMNLP, NAACL, EACL, COLING, and SIGIR is preferred).     Qualifications:        Minimum Qualifications:           BS/BA with 9 years of experience      MS/MA with 7 years of experience      PhD with 5 years of experience            Hazardous Working Conditions/Environment:        Not Applicable    Additional Information:        Requirements:           U.S. Citizenship      Background Investigation: Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter in accordance with 10 CFR 710, Appendix B.      Drug Testing: All Security Clearance positions are Testing Designated Positions, which means that the candidate selected is subject to pre-employment and random drug testing. In addition, applicants must be able to demonstrate non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for the 12 consecutive months preceding completion of the requisite Questionnaire for National Security Positions (QNSP).           Note: Applicants will be considered ineligible for security clearance processing by the U.S. Department of Energy until non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for 12 months can be demonstrated.    Testing Designated Position (TDP):        This position is a Testing Designated Position (TDP). The candidate selected for this position will be subject to pre-employment and random drug testing for illegal drugs, including marijuana, consistent the Controlled Substances Act and the PNNL Workplace Substance Abuse Program.    About PNNL:        Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is a world-class research institution powered by a highly educated, diverse workforce committed to the values of Integrity, Creativity, Collaboration, Impact, and Courage. Every year, scores of dynamic, driven people come to PNNL to work with renowned researchers on meaningful science, innovations and outcomes for the U.S. Department of Energy and other sponsors; here is your chance to be one of them!           At PNNL, you will find an exciting research environment and excellent benefits including health insurance, flexible work schedules and telework options. PNNL is located in eastern Washington State—the dry side of Washington known for its stellar outdoor recreation and affordable cost of living. The Lab’s campus is only a 45-minute flight (or ~3 hour drive) from Seattle or Portland, and is serviced by the convenient PSC airport, connected to 8 major hubs.    Commitment to Excellence, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Equal Employment Opportunity:        Our laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment dedicated to solving critical challenges in fundamental sciences, national security, and energy resiliency. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. In support of this commitment, we encourage people of all racial/ethnic identities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment.              Pacific Northwest National Laboratory considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status, and any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local laws.                    We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures and in employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at hr@pnnl.gov.    Drug Free Workplace:        PNNL is committed to a drug-free workplace supported by Workplace Substance Abuse Program (WSAP) and complies with federal laws prohibiting the possession and use of illegal drugs.

job_title: Data Governance, Advisory Data & AI Tech Specialist - West: WA, ID, OR
job_Description: Introduction      IBM’s Data and AI organization fuels enterprise's journey to AI with data science. At IBM we build and scale AI with trust and transparency to drive digital transformation, deliver personalized customer experiences and help enterprises make more data-backed decisions.              Your Role and Responsibilities      Preference to hire in one of the following cities with flexibility to reside in reasonable commutable distance: Seattle WA, Boise ID, Portland OR, Kent WA, Seatac WA.      IBM’s Data and AI organization is currently seeking a Brand Technical Specialist with experience in DataOps, Master Data Management, Data Governance, and/or Data Integration solutions.  Brand Technical Specialist are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and IBM Business Partners. As a Brand Technical Specialist, you understand the client’s business requirements, technical requirements and competitive landscape. You also apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate software and services into client solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients.              In This Role You Will                Actively develop and progress qualified opportunities with the IBM Sales Team       Act as a deep technical expert in sales opportunities, and leverage your experience to make presales engagements successful       Collaborate with other internal IBM teams to drive unmatched customer satisfaction       Maintain an understanding of the client’s industry, including industry trends, industry business processes       Deliver solution workshops, product demonstrations, technical education, and Proof of Concepts while articulating business value for our dataops solutions       Collaborate with IBM sales teams to define, design, and detail the technical aspects and feasibility of proposed solutions       Support customers across the sales cycle       Assist with Request for Proposal (RFP)/Request for Information (RFI) and other technical questionnaires               #National_Technical              Required Technical and Professional Expertise                Minimum of 3 years of previous experience in a Technical Sales/Solution Consultant/Sales Engineer role or experience working as a data scientist in a business environment       Experience with data governance solutions (Watson Knowledge Catalog, Collibra, Informatica, etc.)       Experience with data integration tools (DataStage, Talend, Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Integration Services, etc.)       Experience with relational and non-relational data stores (Hadoop, Object Stores, DB2, Netezza, MongoDB, EDB, etc.), data Lake and data fabric concepts       Experience in data privacy and regulatory compliance regulations such as GDPR, CCPA, BCBS 239, HIPAA, etc.       Experience working with the sales lifecycle and driving customer outcomes       Excellent interpersonal and communication (oral and written) skills at all levels of an organization       Driven and self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit and a commitment to excellence in everything they do       Ability to build and maintain positive business relationships with peers and clients               Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise                Experience with IBM DataOps solutions (DataStage, InfoSphere, Data Replication, Watson Knowledge Catalog, MDM, etc.)                           About Business Unit      IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.               This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.                      Your Life @ IBM      Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.          Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Quantcast is seeking Senior Machine Learning Engineers to join the Modeling Platform team in our Seattle or San Francisco office.                  As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs one of the world’s most substantial AI-driven insights and measurement platforms, directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. Using machine learning to complement and enhance human knowledge, Quantcast provides marketers and publishers with meaningful audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions throughout the customer journey.                  As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will use our large datasets, computational power, and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse products to support Quantcast’s position as a leader in advertising. You will help lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large-scale machine learning systems in a production environment.                  The Modeling team is developing groundbreaking platforms and algorithms to combine our vast first-party dataset with third-party data to provide the highest quality demographic and behavioral analysis of digital audiences on the market.                    Responsibilities:             Develop highly scalable models for prediction, inference, ranking, and recommendation demonstrating machine learning, statistics, and rule-based algorithms.  Identify fundamental questions in a given technical problem, come up with feasible solutions, and evaluate results to determine a sound final solution.  Participate in the full modeling lifecycle including (but not limited to) data analyses, model prototyping, production coding, model deployment, and performance monitoring to address large-scale and complex inference problems.  Effectively handle tasks and priorities to deliver quality at scale.  Work multi-functionally with data, infrastructure, and operations teams.  Mentor junior engineers to grow their skills.                          Qualifications:             MS in Computer Science or a related technical field with 5+ years of industry experience (or, BS with 8+ years)  Work experience in data analytics and common ML algorithms  Highly qualified in Python programming  Proficient in SQL programming  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Experience mentoring and developing junior ML engineers/scientists                         #LI-AC1                  Quantcast is an advertising technology company and the creator of an innovative intelligent audience platform that empowers brands, agencies and publishers to know and grow their audiences online. Our solutions are leveling the playing field for our customers when it comes to effectively reaching audiences online and helping them power a thriving free and open internet for everyone. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Francisco, Quantcast has employees in 18 offices across 10 countries.                  We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone can be their authentic self. We work to ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.                  Recognizing the importance of flexible work environments, Quantcast adopted a hybrid work model in March 2022. This model gives employees the opportunity to work from home two days a week and work in the office for team collaboration for the remainder of the time. Implementation of our hybrid model may differ based on location or team, so please consult with your hiring manager for further information. All hybrid employees can also work remotely for two weeks each year or, if eligible, apply for our fully-remote work program. To ensure the safety of everyone, all U.S. and Canada employees working from a Quantcast office or who meet clients are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Outside of these locations, we encourage all employees to get vaccinated.

MULTIPLE POSITIONS! MULTIPLE LOCATIONS! OPEN TO REMOTE!        Help us bring the power of AI into Microsoft products, reaching millions of customers, while we Democratize Artificial Intelligence technologies through leveraging petabytes of data to solve real-world problems.        The Artificial Intelligence Platform at Microsoft is growing exponentially! We are looking for Engineers with a great understanding of code with or without direct experience in  AI Frameworks, Azure Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, Conversational AI and the Azure Experimentation Platform.        This is a chance to show what you know, and to grow your Artificial Intelligence knowledge and skill set at one of the greatest companies in technology history!        Some of the many opportunities available include:            AI Frameworks           AI is the next computing revolution, and the AI Frameworks team is at the heart of it. Do you want to be part of a rapidly growing team that builds the best classical and deep learning ML frameworks and inference/training engines for Microsoft? Our ML frameworks code powers Cognitive Services, Azure ML, and forms the backbone of multiple internal inference/training engines like Office/Bing/Speech/Vision which serve a great number of queries every day.          Experimentation Team        The Experimentation Team at Microsoft, under Azure AI Platform, aims to accelerate software innovation through trustworthy experimentation. We build one of the largest experimentation platforms on the planet, ExP, used by teams across Microsoft like Azure, Xbox, Windows, Office, Bing, MSTeams, VSCode, etc. to make data-driven decisions through A/B testing. The ExP platform enables customers to answer questions like: What factors affect the quality of the Bing user experience? What causes users to make a first payment with XBox? How does a new Outlook feature impact Office’s business metrics?        Azure Machine Learning (AML)        Microsoft is at forefront of this AI/ML revolution to help enterprises with platforms to make decisions, train models and learn across their entire product portfolio using Azure Machine Learning Service. If you like challenges and want to develop services to support AI/ML solutions to empower enterprise, organization and AI/ML practitioners to improve their products through AI, then this is your ideal opportunity. We are the AI Platform team in the Cloud and AI platform group, and seeking experienced developers with distributed systems experience.              Cognitive Services           Azure Cognitive Services are bringing AI within reach of every Developer—without requiring machine-learning expertise. All it takes is an API call to embed the ability to see, hear, speak, search, understand, and accelerate decision-making into Microsoft and 3rd party applications. Our mission is to enable commercialization of such cognitive capabilities through Azure as a value differentiator to drive cloud adaption with consistency, ease, and scale.              Conversational AI           As one of Microsoft's most exciting Artificial Intelligence initiatives, Speech Recognition is driving the accuracy and robustness of natural user interfaces, powering experiences such as Cortana, Skype speech to speech translation, Office, and HoloLens, just to name a few. Our group brings together talents in the areas of speech recognition, machine learning, cloud, Distributed Systems, and deep learning to develop and deliver robust, natural, and scalable speech recognition experiences across a rich set of scenarios and languages.           Responsibilities         Contribute technical expertise to help make sound architecture, design and implementation decisions      Partner with and mentor junior team members      Model best practices for quality and live site-focus      Exercise a willingness to learn and share while collaborating with researchers, data scientists and cross-functional teams to improve the AI Platform’s capabilities and address customer requirements        Qualifications         Required Qualifications:            3+ years’ experience in software development and product delivery      3+ years’ experience working with C++, C#, Java, Python or similar language.      A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical IT work experience is required.            Preferred Qualifications:            Proven problem solving, design, coding and debugging skills from prior work on distributed systems, API design and engineering for scale      Experience applying Machine Learning, Statistical data analysis analysis to petabyte-scale data      Experience with Azure or other cloud technologies      Experience making OSS contributions      Familiarity with modern frontend development and HTML, React, TypeScript or Node.js      Masters in computer science, mathematics, statistics or related field               #AIPLAT          #AIPLATFORM          #conversationalai          #botframework                   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
